name: Fiction
description: Narrative literature created from the imagination, not presented as fact.

name: Non-Fiction
description: Factual accounts that present real-life events or ideas.

name: Poetry
description: Artful expression of emotions and ideas through verse.

name: Drama
description: A genre designed for performance, typically involving character conflict.

name: Graphic Novels
description: Narrative works that combine text and illustrations, often resembling comic books.

name: Children's Literature
description: Books written for children, including picture books, early readers, and chapter books.

name: Anthology
description: A collection of works by different authors, typically centered around a theme.

name: Classic Literature
description: Notable literary works that have stood the test of time.

name: Young Adult (YA)
description: Fiction focused on teenage protagonists, dealing with themes relevant to young adults.

name: Inspirational
description: Genre that focuses on uplifting and motivational stories.

name: Sports
description: Books focused on sports themes, including fiction and non-fiction.

name: Historical Fiction
description: Fictional stories set in the past, often incorporating true events and figures.

name: Fantasy
description: Fiction that includes magical or supernatural elements.

name: Mystery
description: Fiction focused on solving a crime or unraveling secrets.

name: Romance
description: Stories centered around romantic relationships.

name: Horror
description: Fiction intended to frighten, scare, or disturb.

name: Thriller
description: Exciting fiction that often features suspense and high stakes.

name: Dystopian
description: Fiction that portrays an imagined society characterized by oppression or environmental disaster.

name: Western
description: Fiction set in the American West, typically during the late 19th to early 20th century.

name: Futuristic
description: Stories set in the future, often emphasizing science, technology, and evolving societies.

name: Literary Fiction
description: Fiction that focuses on character development and thematic depth.

name: Cookbooks
description: Books containing recipes and cooking techniques.

name: Self-Help
description: Books aimed at personal improvement or problem-solving.

name: True Crime
description: Non-Fiction that examines actual criminal events and figures.

name: Environmental Literature
description: Books that focus on nature and environmental issues.

name: Graphic Memoirs
description: Memoirs presented in graphic novel format.

name: Transmedia Storytelling
description: Narratives that unfold across multiple platforms and formats.

name: Music Literature
description: Books focusing on music, musicians, and the impact of music.

name: Philosophy
description: Literature exploring fundamental questions about existence, knowledge, and ethics.

name: Folklore & Mythology
description: Collections of folktales, legends, and mythology from various cultures.

name: Graphic Fiction
description: Fictional stories told through sequential art in comic or graphic novel format.

name: Journal
description: Personal accounts or thematic explorations in a diary or journal format.

name: Asian Literature
description: Literature originating from Asian cultures, often exploring diverse themes.

name: Narrative Non-Fiction
description: Factual stories told with narrative techniques similar to fiction.

name: Parenting
description: Books that offer guidance and wisdom on parenting.

name: Religion & Spirituality
description: Literature exploring faith, spirituality, and religious beliefs.

name: Memoir
description: A collection of memories that an individual writes about moments or events.

name: Humor
description: Literature designed to amuse and entertain.

name: Science
description: Non-fiction literature that explores scientific concepts and discoveries.

name: Technology
description: Literature focusing on technology trends and advancements.

name: Experimental Fiction
description: Fiction that breaks conventional narrative structures and styles.

name: Cultural Criticism
description: Analysis and critique of culture and its impact on society.

name: Anthropology
description: Books exploring human societies, cultures, and their development.

name: Historical Romance
description: Romance novels set in a specific historical context.

name: Medical Literature
description: Books focusing on medicine, healthcare, and related subjects.

name: Culinary Literature
description: Books about food, cooking, and culinary traditions.

name: Post-Colonial Literature
description: Literature that responds to the legacy of colonialism.

name: Cyber Fiction
description: Speculative fiction focusing on the implications of technology and the internet.

name: Western Literature
description: Books focused on themes prevalent in traditional Western narratives.

name: Nature Writing
description: Literature that explores the natural world and human interaction with it.

name: Classic Horror
description: Horror literature that has endured through the years as significant works.

name: Young Adult Fantasy
description: Fantasy literature targeted at a teenage audience.

name: Historical Mystery
description: Mystery novels set in historical contexts.

name: Experimental Poetry
description: Poetry that goes beyond traditional structures and forms.

name: Global Literature
description: Literature from a variety of cultures, providing international perspectives.

name: Children's Fantasy
description: Fantasy literature specifically aimed at children.

name: Military Fiction
description: Literature that focuses on military themes and experiences.

name: Supernatural Fiction
description: Fiction that includes supernatural elements like ghosts and otherworldly beings.

name: Twisted Fairy Tales
description: Reimagined versions of classic fairy tales with darker or unusual themes.

name: Eco-Fiction
description: Fiction that addresses environmental issues and ecological themes.

name: Bipolar Literature
description: Literature that explores themes related to bipolar disorder.

name: Concise Literature
description: Literature that focuses on brevity and succinctness.

name: Sociology
description: Books exploring social behavior and society.

name: Visual Literature
description: Literature that emphasizes visual elements alongside words.

name: Crime Fiction
description: Fiction focused on criminal acts and investigations.

name: Philosophical Fiction
description: Fiction that explores philosophical ideas and questions.

name: Satirical Literature
description: Literature that uses humor, irony, and exaggeration to critique society.

name: Rural Literature
description: Literature that explores rural settings and themes.

name: Meditative Literature
description: Literature that inspires reflection and contemplation.

name: Time Travel Fiction
description: Fiction that involves traveling through time.

name: Folklore Studies
description: Research-oriented literature on folklore and cultural traditions.

name: Literary Theory
description: Explorations and analyses of literature and its various interpretations.
